title: op-replica-data-transport-layer-1:TypeError: Cannot read properties of null

labels.name: C-customer-issue
labels.description: Category: An issue encountered by customers integrating with Optimism

body:
**Describe the bug**
#op-replica-data-transport-layer-1 error logs:

op-replica-data-transport-layer-1  | {"level":50,"time":1668411148974,"extra":{"message":"TypeError: Cannot read properties of null (reading 'from')","stack":"TypeError: Cannot read properties of null (reading 'from')\n    at Object.getExtraData (/opt/optimism/packages/data-transport-layer/dist/src/services/l1-ingestion/handlers/sequencer-batch-appended.js:27:38)\n    at runMicrotasks (<anonymous>)\n    at processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:96:5)\n    at async L1IngestionService._syncEvents (/opt/optimism/packages/data-transport-layer/dist/src/services/l1-ingestion/service.js:230:39)\n    at async L1IngestionService._start (/opt/optimism/packages/data-transport-layer/dist/src/services/l1-ingestion/service.js:140:17)\n    at async L1IngestionService.start (/opt/optimism/packages/common-ts/dist/base-service/base-service.js:33:9)\n    at async Promise.all (index 1)\n    at async L1DataTransportService._start (/opt/optimism/packages/data-transport-layer/dist/src/services/main/service.js:69:13)\n    at async L1DataTransportService.start (/opt/optimism/packages/common-ts/dist/base-service/base-service.js:33:9)\n    at async /opt/optimism/packages/data-transport-layer/dist/src/services/run.js:77:9"},"msg":"Caught an unhandled error"}

 .env config file:
`
COMPOSE_PROJECT_NAME=op-replica
COMPOSE_FILE=replica.yml:replica-shared.yml:replica-toml.yml
ETH_NETWORK=mainnet
DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__L1_RPC_ENDPOINT=http://192.1.1.17:8545
DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__L2_RPC_ENDPOINT=https://mainnet.optimism.io
SEQUENCER_CLIENT_HTTP=https://mainnet.optimism.io
SHARED_ENV_PATH=../envs/mainnet
GCMODE=archive
L2GETH_IMAGE_TAG=0.5.29
DTL_IMAGE_TAG=0.5.48
HC_IMAGE_TAG=1.1.12
L2GETH_HTTP_PORT=9991
L2GETH_WS_PORT=9992
DTL_PORT=7878
GETH_INIT_SCRIPT=check-for-chaindata-berlin.sh
HEALTHCHECK__REFERENCE_RPC_PROVIDER=https://mainnet.optimism.io
HEALTHCHECK__TARGET_RPC_PROVIDER=http://l2geth-replica:8545

RESTART=unless-stopped

\# Sync source
ROLLUP_BACKEND=l2
DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__DEFAULT_BACKEND=l2
DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__L1_GAS_PRICE_BACKEND=l2
DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__SYNC_FROM_L1=true
DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__SYNC_FROM_L2=true
`
then: docker-compose up -d && docker-compose logs -f 
found this issuse at this time

How can I solve this problem ？？？？
Please try setting DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__SYNC_FROM_L1=false

> 

no, i can't set  DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__SYNC_FROM_L1=false, i use DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__L1_RPC_ENDPOINT=http://192.1.1.17:8545/  for sync.

We are RPC providers,If we use other L2 providers, we will be laughed at by others？？？

Now that we use L1, the blocks are no longer synchronized. How can we solve this problem? @smartcontracts

I have the same issue... We need to sync from L1.

The same config that is not working for new nodes is working properly for a node created about 20 days ago, it just stopped working for nodes created more recently than 20 days ago so, given that this issue was opened 16 days ago, I guess this is caused by some update that happened 16 to 20 days ago.

@zhy827827 I saw that you had 

```
ROLLUP_BACKEND=l2
DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__DEFAULT_BACKEND=l2
DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__L1_GAS_PRICE_BACKEND=l2
DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__SYNC_FROM_L1=true
DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__SYNC_FROM_L2=true
```

Configured so I assumed you were trying to sync from L2. If you want to sync from L1 then you will need to set:

```
ROLLUP_BACKEND=l1
DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__DEFAULT_BACKEND=l1
DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__L1_GAS_PRICE_BACKEND=l1
DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__SYNC_FROM_L1=true
DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__SYNC_FROM_L2=false
```

> I have the same issue... We need to sync from L1.
> 
> The same config that is not working for new nodes is working properly for a node created about 20 days ago, it just stopped working for nodes created more recently than 20 days ago so, given that this issue was opened 16 days ago, I guess this is caused by some update that happened 16 to 20 days ago.

I don't immediately see anything in the recent changes that would cause this issue. I know of someone else who ran into this problem and fixed it, going to ask them how they fixed it.

> I don't immediately see anything in the recent changes that would cause this issue. I know of someone else who ran into this problem and fixed it, going to ask them how they fixed it.

Thanks! I'm still seeing this exact same issue no matter how I deploy the new nodes, using both the Docker and the non-Docker way of deploying, so that would be helpful.
@sanbotto were you able to get this issue resolved? I have the same issue and can't figure out what is causing it.  My L1 is serving up just fine to other L2 chains.

> @zhy827827 I saw that you had
> 
> ```
> ROLLUP_BACKEND=l2
> DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__DEFAULT_BACKEND=l2
> DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__L1_GAS_PRICE_BACKEND=l2
> DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__SYNC_FROM_L1=true
> DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__SYNC_FROM_L2=true
> ```
> 
> Configured so I assumed you were trying to sync from L2. If you want to sync from L1 then you will need to set:
> 
> ```
> ROLLUP_BACKEND=l1
> DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__DEFAULT_BACKEND=l1
> DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__L1_GAS_PRICE_BACKEND=l1
> DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__SYNC_FROM_L1=true
> DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__SYNC_FROM_L2=false
> ```

if i use l1 to data sync,then ethereumoptimism/data-transport-layer:latest  have error:

{"level":50,"time":1670926343808,"extra":{"message":"TypeError: Cannot read properties of null (reading 'from')","stack":"TypeError: Cannot read properties of null (reading 'from')\n    at Object.getExtraData (/opt/optimism/packages/data-transport-layer/dist/src/services/l1-ingestion/handlers/sequencer-batch-appended.js:27:38)\n    at runMicrotasks (<anonymous>)\n    at processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:96:5)\n    at async L1IngestionService._syncEvents (/opt/optimism/packages/data-transport-layer/dist/src/services/l1-ingestion/service.js:277:39)\n    at async L1IngestionService._start (/opt/optimism/packages/data-transport-layer/dist/src/services/l1-ingestion/service.js:156:17)\n    at async L1IngestionService.start (/opt/optimism/packages/common-ts/dist/base-service/base-service.js:33:9)\n    at async Promise.all (index 1)\n    at async L1DataTransportService._start (/opt/optimism/packages/data-transport-layer/dist/src/services/main/service.js:69:13)\n    at async L1DataTransportService.start (/opt/optimism/packages/common-ts/dist/base-service/base-service.js:33:9)\n    at async /opt/optimism/packages/data-transport-layer/dist/src/services/run.js:78:9"},"msg":"Caught an unhandled error"}
{"level":30,"time":1670926344318,"highestSyncedL1Block":13596466,"targetL1Block":13598466,"msg":"Synchronizing events from Layer 1 (Ethereum)"}

and ethereumoptimism/data-transport-layer:latest not sync block. I really don't know how to solve the problem of optimism。
@smartcontracts 
Take a moment，thank you~~~
I am having the exact same issue as @zhy827827 using a Geth 1.10.26 archive node.
To anyone having the error "Cannot read properties of null", take a look at this resolved issue: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/4235

> To anyone having the error "Cannot read properties of null", take a look at this resolved issue: #4235

Where you able to determine what was going on with Geth that was causing the issue?  From what I understand, you resolved it by using different Ethereum node software all together.

> > To anyone having the error "Cannot read properties of null", take a look at this resolved issue: #4235
> 
> Where you able to determine what was going on with Geth that was causing the issue? From what I understand, you resolved it by using different Ethereum node software all together.

use alchmy L1, have a same issues

> Where you able to determine what was going on with Geth that was causing the issue? From what I understand, you resolved it by using different Ethereum node software all together.

No. I thought the missing `--http.api` and `--ws.api` flags were the issue but I'm now using `--http.api "eth,txpool,debug,web3,net"` and `--ws.api "eth,txpool,debug,web3,net"` and nothing has changed on the Optimism side, I'm still getting the `Cannot read properties of null` error. Maybe I'm missing a particular API that I don't know about, but that geth node works fine with absolutely everything else...

I haven't had issues with Infura or Alchemy. I'm using both on different nodes.

> 

Let me test it. Thank you, guys @hub-il
@hub-il  hello,guys, hank you for helping me solve this problem.I found the reason:DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__L1_RPC_ENDPOINT= "erigon eth archive node"  can be sync！

> @hub-il 大家好，感谢你们帮我解决了这个问题。我找到了原因：DATA_TRANSPORT_LAYER__L1_RPC_ENDPOINT= "erigon eth archive node" can be sync！

在吗哥
